basic.COMPONENT_EXPL: This section defines RT-Component Basic information.
basic.LANG_EXPL: This section defines a language that is used.
basic.HINT_MODULENAME_DESC:
Specifies the component name to identify RT-Component.
This name will also be used as the base instance name of the component.
Only alphabet, number, hyphen and underscore are available.
basic.HINT_DESCRIPTION_DESC:
Specifies summary of functions that RT-Component provides.
ASCII is available.
basic.HINT_VERSION_DESC:
Specifies the RT-Component version number.
Please specify in x.y.z format (x,y,z is numeric).
basic.HINT_VENDOR_DESC:
Specifies the RT-Component developer's name and vendor name.
ASCII is available.
basic.HINT_CATEGORY_DESC:
Specifies RT-Component category.
If it is not one of the selections, any categories can be specified.
Only alphabet, number, hyphen and underscore are available.
basic.HINT_COMPTYPE_DESC:
Specifies RT-Component type.
- STATIC: RTC that is not generated/deleted dynamically.
- UNIQUE: Unique RTC that is generated/deleted dynamically.
- COMMUTATIVE: RTC that can be generated dynamically.
basic.HINT_ACTIVITYTYPE_DESC:
Specifies RT-Component activity type.
- PERIODIC: Periodic RTC that has a fixed execution cycle.
- SPORADIC: Sporadic RTC that has a unfixed execution cycle.
- EVENTDRIVEN: Event driven RTC
basic.HINT_MAXINST_DESC:
Specifies the maximum number of instances that can be generated.
Specify '0' if it is not restricted.
basic.HINT_EXECUTIONRATE_DESC:
Specifies the execution cycle of the component action in Hz.
This configuration is available only when the component is data-flow-type component.
basic.HINT_ABSTRACT_DESC: Specifies a short description of RT-Component.
basic.HINT_RTCTYPE_DESC:
Used when it needs to specify the kind of RTC that realizes the specific function.
If the value is omitted, it will be regarded as usual RTC.
basic.BASIC_HINT_GENERATE_DESC: Generates RTC skeleton code based on its configuration.
basic.HINT_IMPORT_DESC: Loads the saved contents in RtcProfile format.
basic.HINT_EXPORT_DESC: Outputs the current configuration in RtcProfile format.
script.basic.VALIDATE_NAME2: lease use single-byte characters for [Component name].
script.basic.VALIDATE_MAXINST1: [Number of maximum instance] must be numeric.
script.basic.VALIDATE_MAXINST2: [Number of maximum instance] must be positive value.
activity.ACTIVITY_EXPL: This section specifies the action callback that is used.
activity.LBL_INIT_FINAL: Component Action concerning the component's initialization and finalization
activity.LBL_START_END: Component Action concerning the ExecutionContext's startup and shutdown
activity.LBL_ALIVE: Component Action in the alive state
activity.DOCUMENT_EXPL:
This section specifies a short description of each action.
If the action above is selected, each document can be described.
activity.HINT_ONINITIALIZE_DESC: Initialization. It is invoked only once when the component starts its lifecycle.(Always Valid)
activity.HINT_ONFINALIZE_DESC: Finalization. It is invoked only once when the component finalizes its lifecycle.
activity.HINT_ONSTARTUP_DESC: It is invoked only once when ExecutionContext starts.
activity.HINT_ONSHUTDOWN_DESC: It is invoked only once when ExecutionContext stops.
activity.HINT_ONACTIVATED_DESC: It is invoked only once when the component in the Inactive state is activated.
activity.HINT_ONDEACTIVATED_DESC: It is invoked only once when the component in the Active state is inactivated.
activity.HINT_ONABORTING_DESC: It is invoked only once before the component transits to the ERROR state.
activity.HINT_ONERROR_DESC: It is invoked periodically while the component is in the Error state.
activity.HINT_ONRESET_DESC: It is invoked when the component recovers from the Error state to the Inactive state by reset.
activity.HINT_ONEXECUTE_DESC: It is invoked periodically while the component is in the Active state.
activity.HINT_ONSTATEUPDATE_DESC: It is invoked every time after onExecute.
activity.HINT_ONRATECHANGED_DESC: It is invoked when a rate of ExecutionContext is updated.
activity.HINT_DESCRIPTION_DESC: Specifies a short description of activity.
activity.HINT_PRECONDITION_DESC: Specifies precondition that should be satisfied before executing the activity.
activity.HINT_POSTCONDITION_DESC: Specifies postcondition that should be satisfied after executing the activity.
dataport.TITLE: DataPort Profile
dataport.EXPL: This section defines RT-Component's DataPort Profile information.
dataport.DOCUMENT_EXPL:
This section specifies a short description of each Data Port.
If data port above is selected, each port can be described.
dataport.HINT_DATAPORT_DESC:
A port to send and receive data between RT-Components.
There are an OutPort to send data and an InPort to input data.
To connect an InPort to an OutPort, both data types need to be the same.
dataport.HINT_INPORT_DESC:
A port to input data to RT-Component.
It is connected with other RT-Component's OutPort to receive data.
dataport.HINT_OUTPORT_DESC:
A port to output data to RT-Component.
It is connected with other RT-Component's InPort to send data.
dataport.HINT_PORTNAME_DESC:
Specifies the port name to identify Data Port.
The port name needs to be unique for each port name of InPort, OutPort and Service port within its component.
ASCII is available.
dataport.HINT_DATATYPE_DESC:
Select the data type to be exchanged between data ports from the pull-down menu.
To connect InPort and OutPort, the data types must match.
In addition to the basic types provided by OpenRTM, you can also use your own data types.
If you want to use your own data type, copy the IDL file that defines the data type to the project idl folder and press the Reload button.
The data type you defined will appear in the pull-down list.
dataport.HINT_VARNAME_DESC:
Specifies the variable name associated with Data Ports.
The variable name is different according to the language.
dataport.HINT_DOC_OVERVIEW: Describes the outline of the meaning of data handled by the data port.
dataport.HINT_DOC_DETAIL: Describes the meaning of data types and the meaning of data in components.
dataport.HINT_DOC_DATATYPE: Describes the data type of the data port.
dataport.HINT_DOC_DATANUM: Describes the limit on the number of data in the case of array type.
dataport.HINT_DOC_UNIT: Describes the data unit of the data port.
dataport.HINT_DOC_OCCUR: If the port is OutPort, describe the frequency of occurrence of the data (suddenly, once every XX seconds on average) and its period (XX Hz, etc.)
dataport.HINT_DOC_OPERAT: If the port is InPort, describe the frequency of occurrence of the data (suddenly, once every average of XX seconds) and the cycle (XX Hz, etc.)
script.dataport.VALIDATE_PORTNAME2: Please use single-byte characters for the [DataPort name].
script.dataport.VALIDATE_PORTVARNAME: Please use single-byte characters for the [DataPort variable name].
serviceport.PORT_EXPL: This section defines RT-Component's ServicePort information.
serviceport.IF_EXPL: This section defines RT-Component's Service Interface information.
serviceport.HINT_PORT_NAME_DESC:
Specifies the port name to identify Service Port.
The port name needs to be unique for each port name of ServicePort, InPort and OutPort within its component.
Only half-width alphanumeric characters can be used.
serviceport.HINT_PORT_DESCRIPTION_DESC: Describe the outline description of the service port.
serviceport.HINT_PORT_IFDESCRIPTION_DESC: Describe the outline of the service interface attached to the service port.
serviceport.HINT_IF_NAME_DESC:
Name of the service interface.
Service interface name can not be duplicated.
Only half-width alphanumeric characters can be used.
serviceport.HINT_IF_DIRECTION_DESC:
Type of service interface.You can choose from the following options.
-Provided：Provided interface (for Service Provider)
　-Required：Required interface (for Service Consumer)
serviceport.HINT_IF_INSTANCE_DESC:
The instance name of the service interface.
Only half-width alphanumeric characters can be used.
serviceport.HINT_IF_VARNAME_DESC:
The variable name of the service interface.
If omitted, use the instance name.
serviceport.HINT_IFTYPE_DESC:
Select the service interface type to be used from the pull-down menu.
If you want to use your own interface, copy the IDL file to be used in the idl folder in the project and press the Reload button.
The interface in the IDL file will appear in the pull-down menu.
serviceport.HINT_IDLFILE_DESC: Displays the full path to the IDL file in which the selected service interface type is defined.
serviceport.HINT_IFDESC_DESC: Describe an overview of the service interface.
serviceport.HINT_ARGUMEN_DESC:
Describes the meaning of the argument for each function.
Example: Function name 0 (speed [6], position [6]),
function name 1 (position and orientation), ...
serviceport.HINT_RETURN_DESC:
Describes the meaning of the return value for each function.
Example: Return code = function name 0 (), position = function name 1 (), ...
serviceport.HINT_EXCEPTION_DESC:
Describes the meaning of exceptions for each function.
Function name 0 (): (exception: file not found, argument condition violation),
function name 1 (): (exception: one range error)
serviceport.HINT_PRE_CONDITION_DESC:
Describes the meaning of preconditions for each function.
Function name 0: Precondition, Function name 1: Precondition
serviceport.HINT_POST_CONDITION_DESC:
Describes the meaning of post-conditions for each function.
Function name 0: Post condition, Function name 1: Post condition
script.serviceport.VALIDATE_PORTNAME2: Please use single-byte characters for the [ServicePort name].
script.serviceport.VALIDATE_IFNAME2: Please use single-byte characters for the [Service Interface name].
script.serviceport.VALIDATE_INSTNAME2: Please use single-byte characters for the [Service Interface Instance name].
script.serviceport.VALIDATE_VARNAME: Please use single-byte characters for the [Service Interface variable name].
config.EXPL: This section defines RT-Component Configuration Parameter.
config.DETAIL_EXPL: This section specifies each Configuration Parameter description.
config.HINT_COFIGPARAM_DESC:
A parameter for configuration can be given to RT-Component.
The Configuration Parameter can be modified from outside dynamically when the component is executed.
In order to make reuse more effective, the parameter of algorithm etc implemented in RT-Component is recommended to specify Configuration Parameter.
config.HINT_PARAMNAME_DESC:
Specifies the parameter name to identify Configuration Parameter.
The parameter name must be unique within its RT-Component.
Only alphabet, number, hyphen and underscore are available for the name.
config.HINT_PARAMTYPE_DESC:
Specifies the Configuration Parameter type.
Vector type and enumeration type other than standard type are available.
config.HINT_VARNAME_DESC:
Specifies the variable name associated with the Configuration Parameter.
Actually, the variable name differs depending on the language.
config.HINT_DEFAULT_DESC:
Specifies the default value of the Configuration Parameter.
The default value is used not only when RT-Component is executed, but also when the uninterpreted value was input from outside.
config.HINT_CONSTRAINT_DESC:
Specifies constraint of the Configuration Parameter.
･ No specification : blank
・100(immediate value) : 100
･ Range specification: <、>、<=、>=
･ Enumeration type: (enum0, enum1, ...)
Array type: constraint1, constraint2, ...
･ Hash type : {key0: constraint0, key1: constraint1, ...}
config.HINT_UNIT_DESC: Specifies the unit of the configuration parameter.
config.HINT_WIDGET_DESC:
Specifies a widget to use for defining configuration parameter.
(When you choose 'radio' as Widget, you should specify Enumeration type at Constraint.)
config.HINT_STEP_DESC: Specifies a minimum step when 'slider' is selected as widget for the configuration.
config.HINT_DOC_NAME_DESC: The name of the data.Specify a name that expresses the meaning of the data.
config.HINT_DOC_DEFAULT_DESC: Describes the default value of data and its meaning.
config.HINT_DOC_DESCRIPTION_DESC: A summary of the meaning of the data is described.
config.HINT_DOC_RANGE_DESC: Describes the range of continuous values that the data can take.
config.HINT_DOC_CONTRAINT_DESC: If the data has specific values or constraint conditions (enumeration type specification, array specification, hash type specification, etc.), describe the conditions.
script.config.VALIDATE_NAME2: Please use single-byte characters for the Configuration Set [Parameter name].
script.config.VALIDATE_DEFVALUE: Please enter the [default value] of the Configuration Set Parameter.
script.config.VALIDATE_VARIABLE: Please use single-byte characters for the Configuration Set Parameter [Variable name].
script.config.VALIDATE_VAR_DUPLICATE: Configuration Set Parameter [variable name] is duplicated.
document.HINT_COMPONENT_DESC: Specifies a short description of the components.
document.HINT_ETC_DESC: Specifies additional information on the components.
document.HINT_CREATOR_DESC: The input format is name <mail address>
rtcxml.RTCXML_CAUTION: * In this page, editing XML files directly is not recommended. Only expert users of the RTC specification should modify them direcly.
